column4: hi all, any one plz tell me how to remove mysql completely(even mysql start, stop services as well)
try dpkg autoremove mysql
ok.
when i try "dpkg autoremove mysql" it says it requires action
what kind of action?
have you added sudo ?
yes. i am doing as root user only
what was the error message?
here is the error http://paste.scsys.co.uk/50765
my bad; try this: apt-get autoremove mysql
it says "E: Couldn't find package mysql"
should i give mysql*
dpkg --get-selections | grep mysql
output is here http://paste.scsys.co.uk/50767
apt-get autoremove mysql-server
or dpkg --remove  [all the mysql server packages]

so i thought there is some problem.
then I'm out of ideas, I'm a newbie too
